name: Holiday Inn Express El Centro

reviews.text: I attempted to check in early but my room wasnt ready - the front desk staff could not have been nicer and even called to have the room made up early for me. They were all so very friendly. The hotel is very nice for a Holiday Inn and while I was there they were just landscaping all around the hotel. It seems very new. I will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff and nice motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Could have been a LOT better!

reviews.text: 1- Nice bed with pillow top
reviews.title: Surprisingly nice; it's El Centro after all........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2- Huge room, but as it should be as it was their Presidential Suite!!!
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay!

reviews.text: 3- Walk in shower. Jacussi tub. Great 2 sink bathroom. Seperate toilet area.
reviews.title: Horrible Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the room was large and clean. the breakfast was above average.
reviews.title: would stay again

reviews.text: Very Clean Holiday Inn, nice staff, internet access good. Traveled for business. Since El Centro is small didn't expect such a nice Holiday Inn.
reviews.title: Loved this Holiday Inn
Good place - but thin walls
reviews.text: Definitely a good find for the area. Very clean, very new. I booked a regular room and was upgraded to what I assume is a suite (has a kitchenette, etc.).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I am very happy with this hotel. My only complaint is the thin walls - I can very easily hear people on both sides of my room. Otherwise, great!
reviews.title: best place in...town

reviews.text: On the barren road between Phoenix and San Diego this is on of your better choices for lodging. Located right off Interstate 8 but not ON the interstate this hotel is nice in many ways. Road noise was minimal although I did hear the trains at night. It is probably the nicest hotel in El Centro.
reviews.title: Wonderful Night Sleep

likes.liked: — The great night sleep in a clean and quiet environment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Jacuzzi suite was fantastic, Has a fireplace and two flat screen TVs two rooms,
reviews.title: Top notch

reviews.text: Has all the amenities you need. The breakfast was hot and lots to choose from.
reviews.title: Very Nice Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was great
reviews.title: A great place for business travelers & tourists
A great stay and helpful staff
reviews.text: This must be the best Hotel in the area.
Highly recommend!!
reviews.title: nicest rooms of our road trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Holiday Inn Express is a very basic clean room hotel. We asked for a room overlooking the pool to escape the noise. The parking is a little crazy at the front with some of those tiny tiny spots that you use a can opener to get in and out of your car, but there is more parking in the back. When showering in the morning the water turned suddenly to SCALDING HOT. I jumped out of the water and waited a minute and it turned back. I had to go back under to get off the shampoo....and after a few minutes it went SCALDING HOT AGAIN. It burnt my behind! Not blistering...but large red burn spots! BE CAREFUL!
reviews.title: Scalding Water

reviews.text: This hotel was noisy, and the internet was almost impossible to get and the business centre was one computer in middle of lobby. Terrible for business. Hotels are limited in this place but def. not for those who have to work while they travel.
reviews.title: average but terrible for business travel

reviews.text: In El Centro your choices are limited the Marriott properties by the mall are a little nicer but this hotel is perfectly usable. Not a top performer and it doesn't distinguish itself in any regard but you get what you can expect from this brand. The location is good one exit west of Dogwood. So you are close to most everything. Nice flat screen TVs but no HDTV content so a bit of a waste. The staff is not as friendly as many you will find elsewhere
reviews.title: An average holiday inn express

reviews.text: I often come to El Centro, so thought this one was worth a shot. The hotel seems very nice from the outside and lobby. Location could be better as it does not have anything other than fast food close by. The rooms are better than other hotels I have found here, but my stay had lots of problems. #1 horrible smell. I find out that one of the trash cans was still full. Previous occupant of the room had left a tuna can. Who knows how long that had been there. #2 AC unit did not work. I had to call maintenance who determined housekeeping had unplugged the unit while vacuuming, thus preventing me from using the thermostat. #3 no wifi in my room. No service despite multiple tries. Wifi worked at the outdoor pool and in the lobby.
reviews.title: Could have been better

reviews.text: Rooms are typical. Breakfast was always an issue - kept running out of food, juice, etc. Dryer ruined several pieces of clothes and management was not responsive to fixing or coming up with any other option. This hotel gets worse every year!
reviews.title: Acceptable

aka: Holiday Inn Express El Centro Hotel
description: Welcome to your best option for service, comfort, and value in the Southern California desert. Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites in El Centro offers 100 beautifully appointed, all non-smoking rooms and minisuites with a variety of features and amenities available to ensure that your travel needs are well taken care of. Be sure to start your day off right with our Express Start breakfast; we also have conference and banquet rooms available for your event or business needs. All rooms come equipped with free high speed Internet access, in-room fridge and microwaves, irons, ironing boards, hairdryers and in-room coffee services. Pay per view movies and games are available as well. Pamper yourself in one of our Jacuzzi or balcony suites. We are centrally located in El Centro and within minutes of many recreational activities including golfing, fishing, birdwatching, bowling, museums, shopping and fine dining. El Centro Regional Medical Center and Centinela State Prison are located nearby. The Imperial Valley is famous for seasonal activities such as the Cattle Call Rodeo, the Midwinter Fair and Fiestaand the Blue Angels Air Show, held annually at the nearby Naval Air Facility.Be sure to check out the Imperial Valley Sand Dunesor Glamis, where scenes from your favorite movies have been filmed. Also experience the unique culture south of the border in Mexicali, Mexico, which is known for its shopping and dining.
